item.title: Is it Really Impossible to Make a Living as an Animator in Japan?
item.content:encoded: There have been numerous horror stories about working as a newbie animator in Japan—namely, the inability to earn a living wage. To find out if this was still the case, ANN met freelance and studio-employed animators, studio heads, and animator-rights advocates.

item.title: Why Was Freaks and Geeks Cancelled? NBC’s Ratings Roulette Killed a Future Hit
item.content:encoded: NBC dumped Freaks and Geeks into the Saturday 8 PM slot back in 1999, a graveyard for fresh shows chasing teen eyes. Kids ditched TVs for hangouts, leaving Lindsay Weir’s crew to scrap against cartoons and game shows with zero shot at steady buzz. Episodes dropped out of order, stretched by weeks-long hiatuses for baseball […]

item.title: What Happened to Robert Duvall? Hollywood Icon’s Enduring Legacy
item.content:encoded: Robert Duvall established himself early with a chilling performance as Boo Radley in the 1962 classic To Kill a Mockingbird. That silent, eerie role introduced his intense screen presence to audiences alongside Gregory Peck. He transitioned through various television westerns and police dramas to refine his craft before achieving major cinematic breakthroughs. The 1970s marked […]

item.title: PARANORMASIGHT: The Mermaid's Curse Game Review
item.content:encoded: While its story elements come together in a snug, fantastical narrative, the first entry's gameplay shortcomings remain, and this new game's shift away from spookier, creepier plot beats left me wanting.

item.title: Journal with Witch ‒ Episode 7
item.content:encoded: The notion of motherhood hangs over the entirety of <em>Journal with Witch</em>, like uncertain clouds that might unleash a torrent of rain at any moment.

item.title: Midnight Heart #07 — Cover Story
item.content:encoded: Oh no. The high school student isn't a professional song writer. Impressions: It seems like we're back into doing a march through each girl in turn, and a poor start of it here. An ex-fan of hers is mad at her because she's not Trying Her Hardest™. ie She has songwriter's block. And so […]

item.title: Hell's Paradise Season 2 ‒ Episode 6
item.content:encoded: I have to be honest, I'm not really sure how they're going to get out of this situation given the way the episode ends.

item.title: My Hero Academia: Vigilantes Season 2 ‒ Episode 20
item.content:encoded: I want to make it clear that I didn't hate this episode...but.

item.title: Golden Kamuy Final Season ‒ Episode 56

item.title: Wash It All Away ‒ Episode 7
item.content:encoded: This episode’s social media-centric premise was stretched out a little bit too thin for me.

item.title: Holy Boy Novel Review
item.content:encoded: I can already tell <i>Holy Boy</i> is one of those titles that is going to stay with me for a long time. When I first began reading it, I realized I’d need to close the covers or else I’d be up all night following its characters into the most unsettling recesses of their distorted minds.

item.title: Hana-Kimi ‒ Episode 8
item.content:encoded: Without Umeda around, I suppose <i>someone</i> has to be the one to point out to Mizuki that she's being silly.

item.title: You and I Are Polar Opposites ‒ Episode 6
item.content:encoded: Miyu's reunion with her “ex” isn't exactly high-stakes melodrama, but for a show as fluffy as this one, it might as well be

item.title: Jujutsu Kaisen Season 3: The Culling Game Part 1 ‒ Episode 54
item.content:encoded: This is the most excited I’ve been all season to see what happens next in <i>Jujutsu Kaisen</i>, and it feels like the crux of this season is finally starting in earnest!

item.title: Slave of the Elite #18 — Spear Haver
item.content:encoded: Ah, the advantages of very low expectations. Impressions: I'll be honest, I had completely forgotten that her actual power was copying other powers since she uses the gun thing 99% of the time. Also, Tits McGee had a point that she hadn't done jack squat to that point except rely on someone else, so […]

item.title: Sentenced to be a Hero #06 — Operation “Dig a Hole”
item.content:encoded: This was your grand plan? A hole? Impressions: A lot about this episode rubbed me the wrong way, and I think I'm going to pin that on the script, though certainly the moment in the sewers where it devolved into a series of stills didn't help. The pieces for a solid episode were there […]

item.title: Heck Teacher Nubbsy #19 — The Incredible Stupidity of Horses
item.content:encoded: Just the stupidest of animals. Impressions: Didn't we already have an idiot justice freak monster? That wheel thing? That it even brought back for the pseudo-recap episode? Well, anyway, here's a horse one, but even stupider than the previous, since it's not pissed off about its shrine being desecrated, but… trespassing on private property. […]

item.title: Winter 2026 – Week 6 in Review

item.title: Midnight Heart #06 — The Cake District
item.content:encoded: Five different bakeries on one block, huh? If you're curious about Samurai Troopers, the original guy is just possessed, so everyone goes home and back to the hyperbolic VR time chamber to train some more. And I mean that literally. The baddies full on said "We're leaving, but we'll be back in a week, so […]
